alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Northampton, Greensville, southwestern Southampton, southwestern Sussex and southern Brunswick Counties and the City of Emporia through 500 PM EDT... At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Radium to near Barley to near Brunswick. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Emporia, Purdy, Dahlia, Brunswick, Gaston, Jarratt, Radium, Barley, Gasburg, Claresville, Green Plain, Capron, Adams Grove, Grizzard, Gum Forks, Bufford Crossroads, Lanes Corner, Bowens Corner, Pleasant Shade and Henrico. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
